summary: This is a September 4, 2020 email from an Assistant United States Attorney to Judge Nathan, with copies to defense counsel, submitting agreed-upon proposed redactions to defense letters dated August 24, 2020, in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330). It demonstrates ongoing pre-trial litigation regarding the protective order and document disclosure.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Addressed as the recipient of the email, presumably Judge Alison J. Nathan presiding over the case United States v. Maxwell.

persons.name: S. Cohen
persons.context: Copied on the email, likely a member of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

events.title: Court Order on Proposed Redactions
events.description: The Court issued an order regarding the process for proposing redactions to defense letters.

events.title: Defense Submission of Letters
events.description: The defense team submitted letters to the court, which later became the subject of redaction negotiations.

keyFacts: The prosecution and defense in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell agreed on proposed redactions to defense letters dated August 24, 2020.
The agreement followed a Court Order dated September 2, 2020, indicating judicial oversight of pre-trial document disclosure.
The document lists several members of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team: Jeff Pagliuca, Christian Everdell, S. Cohen, and Mark.
The communication is from an Assistant United States Attorney to Judge Nathan, showing formal legal correspondence in the case.
